# init(contentURL:)

**Initializer**

Returns a `MPMoviePlayerController` object initialized with the movie at the specified URL.

## Declaration

```swift
init!(contentURL url: URL!)
```

## Parameters

- **url**: The location of the movie file. This file must be located either in your app directory or on a remote server.

## Return Value

The movie player object.

## Discussion

This method initializes a movie player, but does not prepare it for playback. To prepare a new movie player for playback, call the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMediaPlayback/prepareToPlay()] method, described in [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMediaPlayback].

To be notified when a new movie player is ready to play, register for the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMoviePlayerLoadStateDidChangeNotification] notification. You can then check load state by accessing the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMoviePlayerController/loadState] property.

To check for errors in URL loading, register for the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMoviePlayerPlaybackDidFinishNotification] notification. On error, this notification contains an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSError] object available using the `@"error"` key in the notification’s `userInfo` dictionary.
